types.description: An object describing filters to apply to webRequest events.

urls.description: A list of URLs or URL patterns. Requests that cannot match any of the URLs will be filtered out.

types.description: A list of request types. Requests that cannot match any of the types will be filtered out.
An array of HTTP headers. Each header is represented as a dictionary containing the keys name and either value or binaryValue.

value.description: Value of the HTTP header if it can be represented by UTF-8.

binaryValue.description: Value of the HTTP header if it cannot be represented by UTF-8, stored as individual byte values (0..255).

types.description: Returns value for event handlers that have the 'blocking' extraInfoSpec applied. Allows the event handler to modify network requests.

cancel.description: If true, the request is cancelled. Used in onBeforeRequest, this prevents the request from being sent.

redirectUrl.description: Only used as a response to the onBeforeRequest event. If set, the original request is prevented from being sent and is instead redirected to the given URL.

requestHeaders.description: Only used as a response to the onBeforeSendHeaders event. If set, the request is made with these request headers instead.

responseHeaders.description: Only used as a response to the onHeadersReceived event. If set, the server is assumed to have responded with these response headers instead. Only return responseHeaders if you really want to modify the headers in order to limit the number of conflicts (only one extension may modify responseHeaders for each request).

authCredentials.description: Only used as a response to the onAuthRequired event. If set, the request is made using the supplied credentials.

functions.name: addEventListener
functions.description: Used internally to implement the special form of addListener for the webRequest events.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

parameters.name: extraInfoSpec
parameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.

functions.name: eventHandled
functions.description: Used internally to send a response for a blocked event.

functions.name: handlerBehaviorChanged
functions.description: Needs to be called when the behavior of the webRequest handlers has changed to prevent incorrect handling due to caching. This function call is expensive. Don't call it often.

events.name: onBeforeRequest
events.description: Fired when a request is about to occur.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

extraParameters.name: filter
extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

extraParameters.name: extraInfoSpec
extraParameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.

returns.description: If "blocking" is specified in the "extraInfoSpec" parameter, the event listener should return an object of this type.

events.name: onBeforeSendHeaders
events.description: Fired before sending an HTTP request, once the request headers are available. This may occur after a TCP connection is made to the server, but before any HTTP data is sent.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

requestHeaders.description: The HTTP request headers that are going to be sent out with this request.

extraParameters.name: filter
extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

extraParameters.name: extraInfoSpec
extraParameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.

returns.description: If "blocking" is specified in the "extraInfoSpec" parameter, the event listener should return an object of this type.

events.name: onSendHeaders
events.description: Fired just before a request is going to be sent to the server (modifications of previous onBeforeSendHeaders callbacks are visible by the time onSendHeaders is fired).

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

requestHeaders.description: The HTTP request headers that have been sent out with this request.

extraParameters.name: filter
extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

extraParameters.name: extraInfoSpec
extraParameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.

events.name: onHeadersReceived
events.description: Fired when HTTP response headers of a request have been received.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

statusLine.description: HTTP status line of the response.

responseHeaders.description: The HTTP response headers that have been received with this response.

extraParameters.name: filter
extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

extraParameters.name: extraInfoSpec
extraParameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.

returns.description: If "blocking" is specified in the "extraInfoSpec" parameter, the event listener should return an object of this type.

events.name: onAuthRequired
events.description: Fired when an authentication failure is received. The listener has three options: it can provide authentication credentials, it can cancel the request and display the error page, or it can take no action on the challenge. If bad user credentials are provided, this may be called multiple times for the same request.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

scheme.description: The authentication scheme, e.g. Basic or Digest.

realm.description: The authentication realm provided by the server, if there is one.

isProxy.description: True for Proxy-Authenticate, false for WWW-Authenticate.

responseHeaders.description: The HTTP response headers that were received along with this response.

statusLine.description: HTTP status line of the response.

extraParameters.name: filter
extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

extraParameters.name: extraInfoSpec
extraParameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.

returns.description: If "blocking" is specified in the "extraInfoSpec" parameter, the event listener should return an object of this type.

events.name: onResponseStarted
events.description: Fired when the first byte of the response body is received. For HTTP requests, this means that the status line and response headers are available.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

ip.description: The server IP address that the request was actually sent to. Note that it may be a literal IPv6 address.

fromCache.description: Indicates if this response was fetched from disk cache.

statusCode.description: Standard HTTP status code returned by the server.

responseHeaders.description: The HTTP response headers that were received along with this response.

statusLine.description: HTTP status line of the response.

extraParameters.name: filter
extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

extraParameters.name: extraInfoSpec
extraParameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.
